description: Schema for submitting information on genetic modification.
title: Genetic Modification

guide_rna_sequences.comment: Guide RNA sequences apply only to modification_technique = CRISPR.

introduced_sequence.comment: Introduced sequences apply only to category = insertion and replacement.

RVD_sequence_pairs.comment: RVD sequence pairs apply only to modification_technique = TALEN and should include at least one entry but no more than two.

method.comment: CRISPR technique requires guide_rna_sequences and/or reagent_availability specified. RNAi requires rnai_sequences and/or reagent availability specified. Specification of reagents for RNAi is not required if the RNAi was a result of a cross between two modified fly strains. TALEs require zygosity, RVD_sequence_pairs and/or reagent_availability specified. Mutagen treatment needs treatment to be specified. All other techniques need reagent_availability and/or supporting documents to be specified.

purpose.comment: Modifications for tagging purposes need to include the introduced_tag property in combination with a target. Modifications for other purposes also need either the site and/or target specified.

treatments.comment: Only treatments for mutagenesis and site-specific recombination should be specified.

introduced_gene.comment: The property introduced_gene is not allowed for modifications of method RNAi or mutagen_treatment.

introduced_tags.comment: Specified introduced protein tags should include at least one entry and apply only to tagging modifications.

rnai_sequences.comment: RNAi sequences apply only to modification_technique = RNAi, for interference and the purposes of repression only.

introduced_elements.comment: introduced_elements are currently restricted to sets of indeterminate elements to be characterized either on episome or inserted randomly.

category.comment: Insertions need to specify introduced_tags, introduced_sequence, introduced_gene, or introduced_elements at modified_site_nonspecific. Replacements need to specify introduced_sequence. Deletions need either target id, coordinates or deleted sequence specified. Interference needs target id specified (unless the purpose is characterization and method is CRISPR) and mutagenesis needs treatment specified. Episome needs to specify introduced_elements.

reagents.comment: Specified reagent availablity details should include at least one entry.

___reagents.description: Details on where reagents (e.g. plasmids) used to produce the described genetic modification can be obtained, if applicable.
___reagents.comment: See source.json for identifiers (e.g. addgene, bacpac, rnai-consortium)
___reagents.title: Reagents

items.description: Details for where a reagent used to produce the described genetic modification can be obtained, if applicable.
items.title: Reagent

___url.description: An external link with additional information about the reagent.
___url.title: URL

___identifier.description: Identifier of the reagent (as assigned by the source) used to produce the describe genetic modification, if applicable.
___identifier.title: Identifier

___source.description: Source where reagent used to produce the described genetic modification can be obtained, if applicable.
___source.comment: See source.json for identifiers (e.g. addgene, bacpac, rnai-consortium)
___source.title: Source

___modified_site_nonspecific.description: Site of modification that is not known (i.e. is random, not targeted).
___modified_site_nonspecific.comment: May be expanded to include extrachromosomal arrays if need arises.
___modified_site_nonspecific.title: Nonspecific modification site

___treatments.description: Relevant mutagenesis treatments applied to result in the modification.
___treatments.title: Treatments

items.description: Relevant mutagenesis treatment applied to result in the modification.
items.title: Treatment

___introduced_tags.description: Protein tags introduced in the modification.
___introduced_tags.title: Introduced protein tags

items.description: Protein tag introduced in the modification.
items.comment: Submit tag name and tag location. If the fusion protein is designed to be expressed with a non-native promoter, please indicate the promoter used by its ENCODE target id.
items.title: Introduced tag

___promoter_used.description: The name (ENCODE target id) of the gene that the promoter regulates natively.
___promoter_used.title: Promoter used in construct

___introduced_elements.description: The origin of a group of elements used for a functional characterization assay.
___introduced_elements.title: Introduced elements

___method.description: The method used to produce the described genetic modification.
___method.title: Method

___purpose.description: The purpose of the genetic modification.
___purpose.title: Purpose

___modified_site_by_coordinates.description: Genomic coordinates specifying the location of the modification.
___modified_site_by_coordinates.title: Modification site by coordinates

___assembly.description: The genome assembly to which modification coordinates relate. e.g. GRCh38.
___assembly.title: Mapping assembly

___chromosome.description: The number (or letter) designation for the target chromosome. e.g. 1, 2L, or X
___chromosome.title: Chromosome

___modified_site_by_gene_id.description: The name of the gene whose expression or product is modified by the genetic modification.
___modified_site_by_gene_id.title: Modification site by gene ID

___documents.description: Supporting documents describing how the genetic modification(s) was/were produced.
___documents.comment: If reagents were not deposited into a repository with relevant details, then please describe the methods in attached documents.
___documents.title: Documents

items.description: Supporting document describing how the genetic modification(s) was/were produced.
items.title: Document

___guide_rna_sequences.description: gRNA sequences used in CRISPR genetic modification.
___guide_rna_sequences.title: Guide RNA sequences

items.description: guide RNA sequence used in the experiment.
items.title: guide RNA sequence

___description.description: A plain text description of the genetic modification.
___description.title: Description

___modified_site_by_target_id.description: The name (ENCODE target ID) of the gene whose expression or product is modified by the genetic modification.
___modified_site_by_target_id.title: Modification site by target ID

___donor.description: The donor or strain the sheared genomic DNA or genomic DNA regions originated from.
___donor.title: Donor

___introduced_sequence.description: If category = insertion or replacement, the newly introduced sequence via the modification.
___introduced_sequence.title: Introduced sequence

___modified_site_by_sequence.description: Genomic sequence specifying location of the modification.
___modified_site_by_sequence.title: Modification site by sequence

___category.description: The category/type of the genetic modification performed.
___category.title: Category

___zygosity.description: The zygosity of the genetic modification.
___zygosity.title: Modification zygosity

___alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
___alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.
___alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions

items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.
items.title: Alternate Accession

___RVD_sequence_pairs.description: The pair(s) of repeat variable diresidue sequences of the TAL effectors that recognize the left and right half sites at a particular location. e.g. NI,NG,NI,HD,NG,NN,NG,NG,NN,HD,NI,NI,NI,NI,NM,HD,HD,NG
___RVD_sequence_pairs.comment: Each cut should be specified by a pair. No more than two pairs should be specified per genetic_modification.
___RVD_sequence_pairs.title: RVD sequence pairs

items.description: The pair of repeat variable diresidue sequences of the TAL effectors that recognize the left and right half sites at a particular location. e.g. NI,NG,NI,HD,NG,NN,NG,NG,NN,HD,NI,NI,NI,NI,NM,HD,HD,NG
items.title: RVD sequence pair

___right_RVD_sequence.description: The repeat variable diresidue sequence of the right half-site for recognized by the TAL effector at a particular location. e.g. NI,NG,NI,HD,NG,NN,NG,NG,NN,HD,NI,NI,NI,NI,NM,HD,HD,NG
___right_RVD_sequence.title: Right RVD sequence

___left_RVD_sequence.description: The repeat variable diresidue sequence of the left half-site for recognized by the TAL effector at a particular location. e.g. NI,NG,NI,HD,NG,NN,NG,NG,NN,HD,NI,NI,NI,NI,NM,HD,HD,NG
___left_RVD_sequence.title: Left RVD sequence

___introduced_gene.description: The identifier of the gene on the ENCODE portal introduced via the modification.
___introduced_gene.title: Introduced gene
